citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility did not have a veterinary approved, documented avian environmental enhancement plan at the time of
inspection. The environmental enhancement plan ensures the psychological well being of birds at the facility. The facility
must document and implement a plan for environmental enhancement that is approved by the attending veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 08 June 2024 (60 days counted from 1st RL Inspection)
or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule
your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility did not have a veterinary approved,  documented avian environmental  enhancement plan at the time of 
inspection. The environmental  enhancement plan ensures the psychological well being of birds at the facility. The facility 
must document and implement a plan for environmental  enhancement that is approved  by the attending veterinarian. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 08 June 2024 (60 days counted from 1st RL Inspection) 
or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule 
your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
